Steve,

Hacking the 1$ radio now. it's going to require a 555 or Micro to
d=
o the sweep/ Looks the reset needs to be pressed to start the sweep
over. 
=

Dollar store my be a great source!

Sum


----- Original Message ----- 
  =
From: Steve Hultay 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, November=
 25, 2007 11:50 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Mini AM/FM Hack Site


  It doe=
sn't matter, the radio sweeps by itself anyway. Both versions 
  i believe =
have buttons on it with a digital face. Mine is White, 
  i'm not sure if t=
hat's the old design or new. The White one you 
  have to pull the pin off =
the board, it's 3rd up from the bottom and 
  says mute next to it. I used =
a pair of needle noise pliers and 
  ripped it out, but probably not the be=
st method. You probably 
  should heat up the solder on the back of the boa=
rd and than just 
  pull it out. It works really well though, i'm gonna try=
 $1 store 
  radios next and see what happens. If it works they also have $=
1 
  store speakers too. A nice $2 combo box w/speakers, sounds too good 
 =
 to be true so i'm sure you can't modify the cheap ones.

  -Steve H.

  --=
